ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:0.5_0: The training rule on receiving robe-cloth
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.2_0: At that time the nun Uppalavaṇṇā was staying at Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.3_0: One morning she robed up, took her bowl and robe, and entered Sāvatthī to collect almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.4_0: She wandered for alms in Sāvatthī. After the meal, on her return from alms-round, she went to the Dark Forest,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.5_0: plunged deep into it, and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.6_0: Just then some bandits had stolen a cow and slaughtered it, and were taking the meat to the Blind Men’s Grove.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.7_0: The head bandit saw Uppalavaṇṇā sitting at the foot of that tree.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.9_0: “If my sons and brothers see this nun, they’ll harass her,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.10_0: and he took a different path.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.11_0: Soon afterwards, when the meat was cooked, he took some of the best meat, tied it up in a palm-leaf packet, hung it from a tree not far from Uppalavaṇṇā, and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.12_0: “He who sees an ascetic or brahmin after giving it to her,” then he left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.13_0: Uppalavaṇṇā had just emerged from stillness when she heard the head bandit making that statement.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.14_0: She took the meat and returned to her dwelling place.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.1.15_0: The following morning she prepared the meat and made it into a bundle with her upper robe. She then rose into the air and appeared in the Bamboo Grove.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.1_0: When she arrived the Buddha had already entered a village to collect almsfood,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.2_0: but Venerable Udāyī had been left behind to look after the dwellings.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.5_0: “He has entered the village to collect almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.6_0: “Please give this meat to the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.7_0: “You’ll please the Buddha with that meat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.8_0: If you give me your sarong, you’ll please me too.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.9_0: “It’s hard for women to get material support, and this robe is the fifth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.11_0: “Sister, just as a man giving an elephant might decorate its girth,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.12_0: so you giving meat to the Buddha should decorate me with your sarong.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.13_0: Uppalavaṇṇā had stopped by Udāyī; then returned to the monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.14_0: The nuns who received Uppalavaṇṇā’s bowl and robe asked her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.16_0: She told the nuns what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.17_0: The nuns complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.18_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī receive a robe from a nun? It’s hard for women to get material support.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.20_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.21_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī receive a robe from a nun?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.22_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.23_0: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.27_0: “Foolish man, a man and a woman who are unrelated don’t know what’s appropriate and what’s inappropriate in dealing with each other, what’s right and what’s wrong.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.28_0: And still you received a robe directly from an unrelated nun.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.29_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.30_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.31.1_0: ‘If a monk receives a robe directly from an unrelated nun, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:1.2.32_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:2.1_0: Then, being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not receive robes from nuns even in exchange.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:2.2_0: The nuns complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:2.3_0: “How can they not receive robes from us in exchange?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:2.4_0: The monks heard the complaints of those nuns
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:2.6_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:2.7_0: “Monks, if it is part of an exchange, I allow you to receive things from five sources: from monks, from nuns, from trainee nuns, from novice monks, and from novice nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:2.8_0: “Monks, if it is part of an exchange, I allow you to receive things from five kinds of people:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:2.9_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:2.10.1_0: ‘If a monk receives a robe directly from an unrelated nun, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.6_0: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back seven generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.8_0: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.10_0: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.11_0: Except if it is an exchange:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.13_0: If he accepts, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.14_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.15_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.16_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.18_0: ‘Venerables, this robe-cloth which I received after receiving it from an unrelated nun is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.19_0: I relinquish them to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.1.22_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.2.1_0: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he receives robe-cloth from her, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.2.2_0: If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it, and he receives robe-cloth from her, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.2.3_0: If she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related, and he receives robe-cloth from her, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.2.4_0: If he receives robe-cloth directly from a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.2.5_0: If she is related, but he perceives her as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.2.6_0: If she is related, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.2.7_0: If she is related, and he perceives her as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.3.3_0: if much is exchanged with little or little is exchanged with much;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.3.4_0: if he takes it on trust;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.3.5_0: if she grabs it for the post;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.3.6_0: if he takes any requisite apart from robe-cloth;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.3.7_0: if it is a trainee nun;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.3.8_0: if it is to a novice nun;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.3.10_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np5:3.3.11_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on receiving robe-cloth, is finished.
